storyTitle: As DevOps Engineer, I want to deploy validation features to staging environment for testing

functional.title: Verify successful automated deployment of validation features to staging environment via pipeline trigger
preconditions: DevOps Engineer is authenticated in Azure DevOps with deployment permissions to staging environment
Validation feature code is committed and merged to the staging branch in the repository
Staging environment is accessible and in healthy state with no ongoing deployments
Azure DevOps pipeline is configured with correct staging environment credentials and endpoints
All required deployment scripts and configuration files are present in the repository

steps.action: Navigate to Azure DevOps Pipelines section and locate the 'Validation Features Deployment' pipeline
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline dashboard displays with 'Validation Features Deployment' pipeline visible and accessible

steps.action: Click 'Run pipeline' button and select 'staging' as target environment from dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline configuration modal opens with staging environment pre-selected and 'Run' button enabled

steps.action: Click 'Run' button to trigger the deployment pipeline
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline execution starts, status changes to 'Running', and real-time logs begin streaming in the console view

steps.action: Monitor the deployment progress through pipeline stages: Build, Test, Deploy, and Verify
steps.expectedResult: Each stage completes successfully with green checkmarks, deployment logs show validation components being installed to staging servers

steps.action: Wait for pipeline completion and verify the final status indicator
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline status shows 'Succeeded' in green, completion time is displayed as under 15 minutes, and success notification appears

steps.action: Navigate to staging environment URL and verify validation features are accessible
steps.expectedResult: Staging environment loads successfully, validation features are visible and functional, version number matches deployed build

postconditions: Validation features are successfully deployed and running in staging environment
Deployment logs are saved in Azure DevOps with detailed status information
Staging environment health checks pass and system is ready for integration testing
Deployment completion notification is sent to DevOps team via configured channels

functional.title: Verify deployment logs provide detailed status and error information throughout deployment process
preconditions: DevOps Engineer has access to Azure DevOps pipeline logs with read permissions
A deployment pipeline run has been executed (either successful or failed)
Logging configuration is enabled in pipeline YAML with verbose mode
Azure DevOps workspace is open in browser with active session

steps.action: Navigate to Azure DevOps Pipelines and select a completed deployment run from the history
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline run details page opens showing overall status, duration, and stage breakdown

steps.action: Click on 'Logs' tab to view detailed deployment logs
steps.expectedResult: Comprehensive logs display with timestamps, stage names, task names, and execution details for each step

steps.action: Expand each deployment stage (Build, Test, Deploy, Verify) and review log entries
steps.expectedResult: Each stage shows detailed information including: commands executed, output messages, resource utilization, deployment progress percentages, and component-specific installation logs

steps.action: Search logs for key deployment milestones: 'Validation components downloaded', 'Database migrations applied', 'Services started', 'Health checks passed'
steps.expectedResult: All key milestones are logged with timestamps, success/failure status, and relevant details such as component versions and configuration values

steps.action: Click 'Download logs' button to export complete log file
steps.expectedResult: Log file downloads as .txt or .log format containing all deployment information with proper formatting and timestamps

postconditions: Deployment logs are accessible and contain comprehensive status information
Log entries include timestamps, stage information, and detailed execution results
Logs are retained in Azure DevOps for audit and troubleshooting purposes
Downloaded logs can be shared with team members for analysis

functional.title: Verify automatic rollback triggers when deployment failure occurs during validation feature deployment
preconditions: DevOps Engineer is authenticated in Azure DevOps with deployment and rollback permissions
Staging environment has a previous successful deployment version available for rollback
Rollback mechanism is configured in pipeline YAML with automatic trigger on failure
Test scenario is prepared to simulate deployment failure (e.g., invalid configuration file)
Monitoring and alerting systems are active to capture rollback events

steps.action: Introduce a deliberate failure condition in deployment configuration (e.g., incorrect database connection string in staging config file)
steps.expectedResult: Configuration file is updated with invalid parameter and committed to staging branch

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline by clicking 'Run pipeline' and selecting staging environment
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline starts execution and proceeds through Build and Test stages successfully

steps.action: Monitor the Deploy stage where the failure condition will be encountered
steps.expectedResult: Deploy stage fails with error message 'Database connection failed: invalid connection string', stage status shows red 'Failed' indicator

steps.action: Observe the pipeline automatically triggering the rollback process without manual intervention
steps.expectedResult: Rollback stage initiates automatically, logs show 'Deployment failure detected, initiating automatic rollback to previous version', rollback tasks begin executing

steps.action: Monitor rollback progress through logs showing restoration of previous deployment version
steps.expectedResult: Rollback completes successfully, logs show 'Rollback completed: staging environment restored to version [previous-version-number]', staging environment is operational with previous version

steps.action: Verify staging environment accessibility and confirm previous version is running
steps.expectedResult: Staging environment URL loads successfully, validation features show previous version number, all services are healthy and functional

steps.action: Check Azure DevOps notifications and alerts for rollback notification
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification sent to DevOps team with subject 'Deployment Failed - Automatic Rollback Executed' including failure reason and rollback status

postconditions: Staging environment is restored to previous stable version after deployment failure
Rollback is logged in Azure DevOps with detailed information about failure cause and rollback actions
DevOps team receives notification about deployment failure and automatic rollback
Failed deployment artifacts are preserved for troubleshooting and analysis

functional.title: Verify deployment completes within 15 minutes performance requirement for validation features
preconditions: DevOps Engineer is authenticated in Azure DevOps with pipeline execution permissions
Staging environment is in optimal state with sufficient resources (CPU, memory, network bandwidth)
Validation feature code is ready for deployment with all dependencies resolved
Azure DevOps agents are available and not overloaded with other pipeline runs
Network connectivity between Azure DevOps and staging environment is stable

steps.action: Navigate to Azure DevOps Pipelines and locate 'Validation Features Deployment' pipeline
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline is displayed and ready for execution

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and click 'Run pipeline' button, select staging environment, and click 'Run'
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline execution starts immediately, start timestamp is recorded in pipeline logs as [start-time]

steps.action: Monitor pipeline execution through all stages: Build (expected 3-4 min), Test (expected 2-3 min), Deploy (expected 6-7 min), Verify (expected 1-2 min)
steps.expectedResult: Each stage progresses without delays, real-time duration counter shows cumulative time increasing, no stages show 'waiting' or 'queued' status

steps.action: Wait for pipeline completion and note the completion timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline completes with 'Succeeded' status, completion timestamp is recorded as [end-time]

steps.action: Calculate total deployment duration by reviewing pipeline summary showing 'Duration: [X] minutes [Y] seconds'
steps.expectedResult: Total deployment duration is displayed as 14 minutes or less, meeting the 15-minute performance requirement

steps.action: Review individual stage durations in pipeline timeline view
steps.expectedResult: Stage breakdown shows: Build (3-4 min), Test (2-3 min), Deploy (6-7 min), Verify (1-2 min), with no stage exceeding expected time ranges

postconditions: Deployment completes successfully within 15-minute performance requirement
Deployment duration is logged and available for performance tracking and analysis
Validation features are deployed and operational in staging environment
Performance metrics are recorded for future optimization and baseline comparison

functional.title: Verify secure credentials management during deployment process with no exposure in logs
preconditions: DevOps Engineer has access to Azure DevOps pipeline configuration and variable groups
Staging environment credentials are stored in Azure Key Vault or Azure DevOps secure variables
Pipeline is configured to use secret variables for sensitive information (database passwords, API keys, connection strings)
Logging configuration is set to mask secret values in pipeline output
Security scanning tools are enabled to detect credential exposure

steps.action: Navigate to Azure DevOps Pipeline settings and review Variables section
steps.expectedResult: All sensitive variables (database passwords, API keys, service account credentials) are marked with lock icon indicating 'secret' type, values are masked with asterisks

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline to staging environment
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline starts execution and proceeds through all stages

steps.action: Monitor deployment logs in real-time, specifically looking for any credential or secret values
steps.expectedResult: All secret values in logs are masked and displayed as '***' or '[secret]', no plain-text passwords, connection strings, or API keys are visible

steps.action: Search logs for keywords: 'password', 'apikey', 'secret', 'connectionstring', 'token'
steps.expectedResult: Search results show only masked values or variable names, no actual secret values are exposed in log output

steps.action: Download complete log file and perform text search for sensitive patterns (e.g., connection string format, API key patterns)
steps.expectedResult: Downloaded logs contain no exposed credentials, all sensitive information is properly masked or omitted

steps.action: Verify that deployment successfully authenticated to staging environment using secure credentials
steps.expectedResult: Deployment completes successfully, logs show 'Authentication successful' messages without revealing credential values, staging services are running with proper configuration

postconditions: Deployment completes successfully using securely managed credentials
No credentials or secrets are exposed in pipeline logs or output
Audit trail shows secure credential access from Azure Key Vault or secure variables
Security compliance requirements are met for credential management

functional.title: Verify integration tests run automatically after successful deployment to staging environment
preconditions: DevOps Engineer has triggered deployment pipeline to staging environment
Validation features have been successfully deployed to staging
Integration test suite is configured in pipeline with test scripts and test data
Staging environment is accessible from test execution agents
Test reporting tools are configured to capture and display test results

steps.action: Monitor deployment pipeline after Deploy stage completes successfully
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline automatically proceeds to 'Integration Tests' stage without manual intervention, stage status changes to 'Running'

steps.action: Observe integration test execution in pipeline logs showing test discovery and execution
steps.expectedResult: Logs display 'Discovering integration tests...', 'Found [X] test cases', 'Executing integration tests against staging environment at [staging-url]'

steps.action: Monitor test execution progress showing individual test results
steps.expectedResult: Logs show each test case executing with pass/fail status: 'Test: Validate user authentication - PASSED', 'Test: Validate data submission - PASSED', test progress counter updates (e.g., '5/10 tests completed')

steps.action: Wait for integration test suite completion and review test summary
steps.expectedResult: Integration Tests stage completes with status 'Succeeded', test summary shows 'Total: [X] tests, Passed: [X], Failed: 0, Duration: [Y] seconds'

steps.action: Click on 'Tests' tab in pipeline run to view detailed test results
steps.expectedResult: Test results dashboard displays with all integration tests listed, pass rate shown as 100%, individual test details available including execution time and assertions

steps.action: Verify test report is generated and accessible for download
steps.expectedResult: Test report link is available, clicking it downloads HTML or XML report with comprehensive test results, screenshots, and execution details

postconditions: Integration tests execute automatically after deployment without manual trigger
Test results are captured and available in Azure DevOps test reporting
Deployment pipeline completes fully only after integration tests pass
Test artifacts and reports are stored for audit and analysis purposes

negative.title: Verify deployment fails gracefully when staging environment is unreachable or offline
preconditions: DevOps Engineer is authenticated in Azure DevOps with deployment permissions
Staging environment is intentionally made unreachable (network blocked, servers stopped, or firewall rules blocking access)
Deployment pipeline is configured with connection timeout settings
Rollback mechanism is enabled and previous deployment version is available

steps.action: Ensure staging environment is unreachable by stopping staging servers or blocking network access
steps.expectedResult: Staging environment URL returns connection timeout or 'server not found' error when accessed

steps.action: Navigate to Azure DevOps Pipelines and trigger 'Validation Features Deployment' pipeline for staging environment
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline starts execution and proceeds through Build and Test stages successfully

steps.action: Monitor Deploy stage where connection to staging environment is attempted
steps.expectedResult: Deploy stage shows error message 'Failed to connect to staging environment: connection timeout after 60 seconds', stage status changes to 'Failed' with red indicator

steps.action: Verify pipeline does not hang indefinitely and fails within configured timeout period
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline fails within 2-3 minutes of connection attempt, does not remain in 'Running' state indefinitely, clear timeout error is logged

steps.action: Observe automatic rollback trigger due to deployment failure
steps.expectedResult: Rollback stage initiates automatically with message 'Deployment failed: staging environment unreachable, initiating rollback', however rollback may also fail if environment is completely offline

steps.action: Check pipeline notifications and alerts sent to DevOps team
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification sent with subject 'Deployment Failed: Staging Environment Unreachable', email includes error details, timestamp, and recommended actions

postconditions: Deployment fails with clear error message indicating staging environment is unreachable
Pipeline does not hang or timeout indefinitely, fails within configured timeout period
DevOps team is notified of deployment failure with actionable error information
Deployment failure is logged in Azure DevOps with detailed error information for troubleshooting

negative.title: Verify deployment fails when DevOps Engineer lacks required permissions to deploy to staging environment
preconditions: Test user account is created in Azure DevOps with limited permissions (read-only or contributor without deployment rights)
Test user does not have 'Deploy to Staging' permission in Azure DevOps project settings
Staging environment access control is configured to require specific deployment permissions
Test user is logged into Azure DevOps with restricted account

steps.action: Log into Azure DevOps using test account with insufficient deployment permissions
steps.expectedResult: Azure DevOps dashboard loads successfully, user can view pipelines but has restricted access

steps.action: Navigate to Pipelines section and locate 'Validation Features Deployment' pipeline
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline is visible in the list but 'Run pipeline' button may be disabled or grayed out

steps.action: Attempt to click 'Run pipeline' button to trigger deployment
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears: 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to run this pipeline' or 'Insufficient permissions to deploy to staging environment', button click is blocked

steps.action: If pipeline run is somehow initiated (via API or other means), monitor for permission failure during deployment
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline fails at Deploy stage with error 'Authorization failed: user [username] does not have Deploy permission for staging environment', deployment does not proceed

steps.action: Verify that no partial deployment occurs and staging environment remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Staging environment shows previous deployment version, no new components are installed, environment state is unchanged

steps.action: Check audit logs for permission denial event
steps.expectedResult: Azure DevOps audit log contains entry: 'Deployment attempt denied for user [username] to staging environment due to insufficient permissions' with timestamp

postconditions: Deployment is blocked due to insufficient permissions
Staging environment remains in previous stable state with no unauthorized changes
Permission denial is logged in Azure DevOps audit trail
User receives clear error message indicating permission issue and required access level

negative.title: Verify deployment fails when deployment scripts contain syntax errors or invalid commands
preconditions: DevOps Engineer has access to deployment script repository with write permissions
Deployment scripts are intentionally modified to include syntax errors (e.g., missing semicolon, invalid command, wrong parameter)
Modified scripts are committed to staging branch
Pipeline is configured to execute deployment scripts during Deploy stage

steps.action: Modify deployment script to include syntax error (e.g., change 'npm install' to 'npm instal' or add invalid PowerShell command)
steps.expectedResult: Script file is updated with syntax error and committed to repository

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline by clicking 'Run pipeline' and selecting staging environment
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline starts execution and proceeds through Build stage

steps.action: Monitor Deploy stage where the erroneous script is executed
steps.expectedResult: Deploy stage fails with error message showing script execution failure: 'Error executing deployment script: command not found: instal' or 'Syntax error in deploy.ps1 at line 45', stage status shows 'Failed'

steps.action: Review deployment logs for detailed error information including script name, line number, and error description
steps.expectedResult: Logs display detailed error: 'Script: deploy-validation.sh, Line: 23, Error: unexpected token near }', full stack trace is provided for troubleshooting

steps.action: Verify automatic rollback is triggered due to script execution failure
steps.expectedResult: Rollback stage initiates automatically with message 'Deployment script failed, initiating rollback to previous version', staging environment is restored to previous state

steps.action: Check that staging environment remains operational with previous version after rollback
steps.expectedResult: Staging environment URL loads successfully, previous version of validation features is running, no broken or partially deployed components exist

postconditions: Deployment fails with clear error message identifying script syntax error
Automatic rollback restores staging environment to previous stable version
Error details including script name, line number, and error description are logged
DevOps team is notified of deployment failure with script error details for correction

negative.title: Verify deployment fails when staging environment has insufficient resources (disk space, memory, CPU)
preconditions: DevOps Engineer has access to staging environment infrastructure monitoring
Staging environment is configured with limited resources or disk space is artificially filled to near capacity (95%+ used)
Resource monitoring is enabled in deployment pipeline to check environment health
Deployment requires specific minimum resources (e.g., 2GB free disk space, 1GB available memory)

steps.action: Verify staging environment has insufficient disk space by checking server storage showing 98% disk usage
steps.expectedResult: Staging server monitoring shows disk space at 98% capacity with only 200MB free, below required 2GB minimum

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline to staging environment
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline starts execution and proceeds through Build and Test stages

steps.action: Monitor Deploy stage where pre-deployment health check validates environment resources
steps.expectedResult: Deploy stage fails at pre-deployment validation with error 'Insufficient disk space on staging server: 200MB available, 2GB required', deployment is aborted before any changes are made

steps.action: Review deployment logs for resource constraint details
steps.expectedResult: Logs show detailed resource check results: 'Disk Space: 200MB/2GB required - FAILED', 'Memory: 4GB/1GB required - PASSED', 'CPU: Available - PASSED', clear indication of which resource constraint caused failure

steps.action: Verify that no deployment artifacts are copied to staging environment due to pre-deployment check failure
steps.expectedResult: Staging environment remains unchanged, no new files are copied, previous version continues running, disk space usage remains at 98%

steps.action: Check alert notification sent to DevOps team about resource constraint
steps.expectedResult: Alert email sent with subject 'Deployment Failed: Insufficient Resources on Staging Environment', includes resource details and recommendation to free disk space or increase capacity

postconditions: Deployment fails before making any changes due to insufficient resources
Staging environment remains in previous stable state
Resource constraint details are logged with specific metrics (available vs required)
DevOps team is notified with actionable information to resolve resource issue

negative.title: Verify deployment fails when required environment variables or configuration files are missing
preconditions: DevOps Engineer has access to pipeline configuration and variable groups
Required environment variables for staging deployment are intentionally removed or not set (e.g., DATABASE_URL, API_ENDPOINT, SERVICE_KEY)
Deployment scripts are configured to validate presence of required environment variables
Pipeline is ready to be triggered for staging deployment

steps.action: Navigate to Azure DevOps Pipeline Variables section and delete or comment out required environment variable 'DATABASE_URL'
steps.expectedResult: Environment variable 'DATABASE_URL' is removed from pipeline variables, change is saved

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline to staging environment
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline starts execution and proceeds through Build stage

steps.action: Monitor Deploy stage where environment variable validation occurs
steps.expectedResult: Deploy stage fails with error message 'Missing required environment variable: DATABASE_URL', validation check prevents deployment from proceeding, stage status shows 'Failed'

steps.action: Review deployment logs for complete list of missing configuration items
steps.expectedResult: Logs display 'Configuration Validation Failed: Missing required variables: [DATABASE_URL], Missing required files: [none]', clear indication of what needs to be provided

steps.action: Verify that deployment does not proceed with missing configuration and no partial deployment occurs
steps.expectedResult: Deployment is completely aborted, no components are installed to staging, previous version continues running without interruption

steps.action: Attempt to trigger deployment with missing configuration file (e.g., delete staging-config.json from repository)
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline fails with error 'Required configuration file not found: staging-config.json', deployment is blocked at validation stage

postconditions: Deployment fails with clear error message listing missing environment variables or configuration files
No partial deployment occurs, staging environment remains in previous stable state
Configuration validation errors are logged with specific details about missing items
DevOps Engineer receives actionable error message to add missing configuration before retrying

negative.title: Verify deployment fails when database migration scripts fail during deployment process
preconditions: DevOps Engineer is authenticated in Azure DevOps with deployment permissions
Validation features deployment includes database migration scripts
Database migration script is intentionally modified to include error (e.g., reference non-existent table, invalid SQL syntax, constraint violation)
Staging database is accessible and in known state
Rollback mechanism includes database rollback capability

steps.action: Modify database migration script to include SQL error (e.g., 'ALTER TABLE non_existent_table ADD COLUMN new_field VARCHAR(50)')
steps.expectedResult: Migration script is updated with invalid SQL and committed to repository

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline to staging environment
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline starts execution and proceeds through Build and Test stages successfully

steps.action: Monitor Deploy stage where database migration scripts are executed
steps.expectedResult: Deploy stage fails during database migration with error 'Database migration failed: Table non_existent_table does not exist', SQL error code and details are displayed in logs

steps.action: Review deployment logs for database migration error details including failed script name and SQL statement
steps.expectedResult: Logs show 'Migration script: 003_add_validation_fields.sql, Line: 12, Error: [42S02] Table non_existent_table doesn't exist', full SQL statement that failed is logged

steps.action: Verify automatic rollback is triggered including database rollback to previous schema version
steps.expectedResult: Rollback stage initiates with message 'Database migration failed, rolling back database changes and application deployment', database rollback script executes successfully

steps.action: Verify staging database schema is restored to previous version after rollback
steps.expectedResult: Database schema matches pre-deployment state, no partial migrations are applied, data integrity is maintained, application connects successfully to rolled-back database

steps.action: Check staging environment functionality with rolled-back database
steps.expectedResult: Staging environment loads successfully with previous version, all database queries execute without errors, no data corruption or orphaned records exist

postconditions: Deployment fails when database migration encounters error
Automatic rollback restores both application code and database schema to previous version
Database integrity is maintained with no partial migrations or data corruption
Detailed error information about failed migration is logged for troubleshooting

usability.testData: Simulated failure scenarios: network timeout, permission denied, disk space full, failed validation tests, missing dependencies
toolsRequired: Network simulation tools for connectivity failures
Staging environment with configurable resource limits

reliability.title: Deployment Pipeline Resilience Under Azure DevOps Service Degradation
reliability.description: Validate deployment pipeline behavior when Azure DevOps experiences service degradation or temporary unavailability during deployment execution. Test circuit breaker activation, retry mechanisms, and graceful degradation to ensure deployment either completes successfully or fails safely with proper rollback.
preconditions: Staging environment is operational and accessible
Azure DevOps pipeline is configured with retry and timeout policies
Monitoring and alerting systems are active
Baseline deployment time is established (target: <15 minutes)
Chaos engineering tool (e.g., Azure Chaos Studio) is configured

steps.action: Establish steady state: Execute normal deployment to staging and record success metrics (deployment time, success rate, resource utilization)
steps.expectedResult: Deployment completes successfully in <15 minutes with all validation features operational

steps.action: Define hypothesis: System will retry failed API calls to Azure DevOps and complete deployment within 20 minutes or trigger rollback within 5 minutes if unrecoverable
steps.expectedResult: Hypothesis documented with measurable success criteria

steps.action: Inject failure: Simulate Azure DevOps API latency (5-10 second delays) and intermittent 503 errors (30% failure rate) during deployment trigger phase
steps.expectedResult: Chaos experiment activated with controlled blast radius limited to staging environment

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline and monitor retry behavior, circuit breaker state transitions, and deployment progress
steps.expectedResult: Pipeline retries failed API calls with exponential backoff (2s, 4s, 8s intervals), circuit breaker remains closed or transitions to half-open state

steps.action: Verify deployment outcome: Check if deployment completes successfully or triggers automatic rollback
steps.expectedResult: Either deployment completes within 20 minutes with all features validated OR automatic rollback executes within 5 minutes restoring previous stable state

steps.action: Validate recovery metrics: Measure MTTR (Mean Time To Recovery) and verify no data corruption or partial deployments exist
steps.expectedResult: MTTR â‰¤ 5 minutes, staging environment returns to stable state, no orphaned resources or configuration drift detected

postconditions: Staging environment is in known stable state (either new deployment or rolled back)
All monitoring alerts are cleared
Chaos experiment is terminated
Deployment logs captured for analysis
reliability.testData: Azure DevOps API endpoints, deployment manifest files, validation feature artifacts, chaos experiment configuration (latency: 5-10s, error rate: 30%)

reliability.title: Deployment Rollback Validation and Data Integrity Under Mid-Deployment Failure
reliability.description: Test automatic rollback mechanism when deployment fails mid-execution due to resource exhaustion or configuration errors. Validate that rollback completes within RTO (5 minutes), maintains data integrity, and restores staging environment to last known good state with zero data loss (RPO = 0).
preconditions: Staging environment has previous stable deployment version
Rollback scripts are configured and tested
Database backup exists for current staging state
Deployment monitoring dashboards are operational
Resource limits are defined (CPU: 80%, Memory: 85%, Disk: 90%)

steps.action: Establish baseline: Document current staging environment state including database schema version, configuration files, and deployed artifact versions
steps.expectedResult: Complete inventory of staging environment captured with checksums and version tags

steps.action: Inject failure condition: Simulate disk space exhaustion (fill disk to 98% capacity) during deployment artifact extraction phase
steps.expectedResult: Disk space reaches critical threshold triggering deployment failure detection

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline with validation features and monitor for failure detection
steps.expectedResult: Deployment fails during artifact extraction with error logged: 'Insufficient disk space' within 3 minutes of start

steps.action: Verify automatic rollback initiation: Monitor rollback trigger and execution progress
steps.expectedResult: Rollback automatically initiates within 30 seconds of failure detection, rollback script executes with progress logged

steps.action: Validate rollback completion: Check that previous deployment version is restored including all configuration files, database state, and service endpoints
steps.expectedResult: Rollback completes within 5 minutes (RTO compliance), all services return to operational state matching pre-deployment baseline

steps.action: Verify data integrity: Compare database checksums, configuration file hashes, and run integration tests against rolled-back environment
steps.expectedResult: Zero data loss confirmed (RPO = 0), all checksums match baseline, integration tests pass with 100% success rate

steps.action: Measure recovery metrics: Calculate actual MTTR and verify availability SLO impact
steps.expectedResult: MTTR â‰¤ 5 minutes, staging availability remains >99.5% for the measurement period

postconditions: Staging environment fully restored to pre-deployment state
Disk space cleaned up and returned to normal levels (<70%)
Rollback success logged and alerts sent to DevOps team
Post-mortem data collected for analysis
reliability.testData: Previous deployment artifacts, database backup files, configuration baselines, disk fill scripts, checksum validation tools
toolsRequired: Database comparison tools (e.g., SQL Data Compare)

reliability.title: Deployment Resilience Under Staging Database Connection Failure
reliability.description: Validate deployment pipeline behavior when staging database becomes unavailable during deployment health check phase. Test connection retry logic, circuit breaker patterns, and graceful degradation to ensure deployment fails safely without leaving environment in inconsistent state.
preconditions: Staging database is operational with connection pooling configured
Database connection retry policy is defined (max 3 retries, 5s timeout)
Circuit breaker thresholds configured (5 failures in 30s window)
Health check endpoints are implemented for all validation features
Network chaos tools are available (e.g., Toxiproxy, Azure Chaos Studio)

steps.action: Establish steady state: Execute successful deployment and verify all validation features can connect to staging database with <500ms latency
steps.expectedResult: Deployment completes successfully, all database connections established, health checks return 200 OK

steps.action: Define chaos hypothesis: When database becomes unavailable, circuit breaker will open after 5 failed connection attempts and deployment will rollback within 5 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Hypothesis documented with measurable circuit breaker state transitions

steps.action: Inject network partition: Block all traffic between staging application servers and database using network chaos tool during post-deployment health check phase
steps.expectedResult: Network partition active, database connection attempts timeout after 5 seconds

steps.action: Trigger deployment and monitor connection retry attempts and circuit breaker state
steps.expectedResult: Deployment proceeds to health check phase, connection retries occur 3 times with 5s timeouts, circuit breaker opens after 5 consecutive failures (within 30s)

steps.action: Verify deployment failure handling: Check that deployment is marked as failed and rollback is triggered
steps.expectedResult: Deployment fails with error 'Database health check failed - circuit breaker open', automatic rollback initiates within 30 seconds

steps.action: Remove network partition and validate environment recovery: Verify circuit breaker transitions to half-open then closed state
steps.expectedResult: Network connectivity restored, circuit breaker attempts test request, transitions to half-open then closed state within 60 seconds, staging environment operational

steps.action: Measure resilience metrics: Calculate MTTR and verify no database connection leaks or orphaned transactions
steps.expectedResult: MTTR â‰¤ 6 minutes, connection pool returns to normal state, no orphaned transactions or locks detected

postconditions: Network partition removed and connectivity restored
Circuit breaker in closed state
Staging environment rolled back to stable state
All database connections properly closed
Monitoring alerts cleared
reliability.testData: Database connection strings, network partition rules, circuit breaker configuration (threshold: 5 failures/30s), health check endpoints

reliability.title: Deployment Pipeline Stress Test Under Concurrent Resource Contention
reliability.description: Execute chaos experiment simulating high resource contention (CPU 90%, Memory 85%) on staging environment during deployment to validate pipeline behavior under stress. Test deployment time degradation, resource allocation priorities, and system stability to ensure deployment completes or fails gracefully within acceptable SLO boundaries.
preconditions: Staging environment baseline resource utilization documented (CPU: <40%, Memory: <60%)
Resource limits and quotas configured in Azure
Deployment SLO defined: completion time <15 minutes under normal load, <25 minutes under stress
Stress testing tools configured (e.g., stress-ng, Azure Load Testing)
Auto-scaling policies documented and temporarily disabled for test

steps.action: Establish steady state baseline: Execute 3 consecutive deployments under normal load and record average completion time, resource utilization, and success rate
steps.expectedResult: Average deployment time: 10-12 minutes, CPU: 35-45%, Memory: 55-65%, Success rate: 100%

steps.action: Define chaos hypothesis: Under 90% CPU and 85% memory load, deployment will complete within 25 minutes OR fail gracefully with rollback within 30 minutes total
steps.expectedResult: Hypothesis documented with blast radius limited to staging environment only

steps.action: Inject resource contention: Start CPU stress (90% utilization) and memory pressure (85% utilization) on all staging application servers
steps.expectedResult: Resource utilization reaches target levels within 2 minutes, system remains responsive but degraded

steps.action: Trigger deployment pipeline and monitor deployment progress, resource allocation, and system responsiveness
steps.expectedResult: Deployment initiates successfully, progress is slower than baseline, resource monitoring shows contention for CPU/memory

steps.action: Monitor deployment phases: artifact download, extraction, configuration, service restart, health checks
steps.expectedResult: Each phase completes but with 50-100% longer duration than baseline, no phase timeouts or crashes occur

steps.action: Verify deployment outcome and measure completion time or rollback time
steps.expectedResult: Deployment completes within 25 minutes with all validation features operational OR rollback completes within 30 minutes if deployment exceeds timeout

steps.action: Remove resource stress and validate system recovery: measure time to return to steady state
steps.expectedResult: Resource utilization returns to baseline (<50% CPU, <70% Memory) within 5 minutes, MTTR â‰¤ 5 minutes, system stability confirmed

postconditions: Resource stress removed from all staging servers
Staging environment in stable operational state
Resource utilization returned to normal baseline levels
Deployment outcome logged (success or rollback)
Performance metrics captured for SLO analysis
reliability.testData: Stress test configuration (CPU: 90%, Memory: 85%), deployment artifacts, resource monitoring baselines, SLO thresholds (15min normal, 25min stress)

userStoryObject.title: As DevOps Engineer, I want to deploy validation features to staging environment for testing
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:

Validation features need deployment in a controlled environment for integration testing.

CURRENT STATE:

Manual deployment causes delays and inconsistencies.

DESIRED STATE:

Automated deployment pipeline ensures consistent and timely releases to staging.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:

  • Create deployment scripts for validation components
  • Automate deployment to staging environment
  • Monitor deployment success and rollback on failure


USER INTERACTION FLOW:

  1. Trigger deployment pipeline
  2. System deploys validation features to staging
  3. Verify deployment success
  4. Run integration tests


TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:

  • Tools: Azure DevOps pipelines
  • Security: Secure credentials management


OUT OF SCOPE:

  • Production deployment


SUCCESS METRICS:

  • Deployment completes without errors 100% of attempts
  • Rollback triggers on deployment failure
  • Deployment time under
15 minutes

Persona: DevOps Engineer (DevOps Engineer)
userStoryObject.acceptanceCriteria:
Criteria 1: Deployment pipeline automates validation feature deployment to staging

Criteria 2: Any deployment failure triggers automatic rollback

Criteria 3: Deployment logs provide detailed status and error information

Criteria 4: Deployment completes within 15 minutes
